name: dodderer
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
someone who moves around slowly and weakly, as if they might fall, especially because of being very old: When he talks to sixth-formers, he starts off by saying that they probably think he's a dusty old dodderer.
More examplesFewer examplesThey portrayed him as an old dodderer who had lost his memory. The Prince's tutor is a sweet-tempered old dodderer.Lear makes his entrance hobbling painfully forward on a stick like some senile and decrepit dodderer. Will we become a nation of dodderers? That depends on how we age.
